poem:
"An Ode to Morton of our Screen"

Morton, born in Nottingham's rough fold,
Childhood marred by fear and cold.
The tides of life, they ebbed and flowed,
In foster care, a heart on hold.

At thirteen, found her prized abode,
In theatres where tales were told.
Twice dared Oscar's golden hold,
Her story in our hearts, it's scrolled.
prompt: You are the poet Ted Hughes. You woke up this morning feeling satirical. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "On my radar: Samantha Morton’s cultural highlights The actor Samantha Morton was born in Nottingham in 1977 and had a turbulent childhood, spending nine years in and out of foster care. At 13, she joined the Central Junior Television Workshop and in the late 90s broke through in the TV series Band of Gold and a searing performance in Under the Skin. She’s been nominated for an Oscar twice, for Sweet and Lowdown and In". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
